s1: Society relies on many complex systems of interacting technology, people, processes, laws and other elements. Examples of such systems include air transport, telecommunications and energy supply.
s2: Society relies on many complex systems of interacting technology, people, processes, laws and other elements. Examples of such systems include air transport, telecommunications and energy supply.

s1: Systems Engineering is a holistic, multi-disciplinary and well established approach to the engineering of these complex systems.
s2: Systems Engineering is a holistic, multi-disciplinary and well established approach to the engineering of these complex systems.

s1: Because software is a critical component of such systems, Software Engineers will often work in Systems Engineering teams.
s2: Because software is a critical component of such systems, Software Engineers will often work in Systems Engineering teams.

s1: The Systems Engineering life-cycle and processes.
s2: The Systems Engineering life-cycle and processes.

s1: Conceptual system design: including problem definition, technical performance measures, quality function deployment (QFD), trade-off analyses, and system specification.
s2: Conceptual system design: including problem definition, technical performance measures, quality function deployment (QFD), trade-off analyses, and system specification.

s1: Preliminary system design: subsystem design requirements, design review.
s2: Preliminary system design: subsystem design requirements, design review.

s1: Detailed design and development: Detailed design requirements and design engineering activities; review and feedback, and incorporation of design changes.
s2: Detailed design and development: Detailed design requirements and design engineering activities; review and feedback, and incorporation of design changes.

s1: Design for sustainability: approaches that integrate sustainability principles into the design process.
s2: Design for sustainability: approaches that integrate sustainability principles into the design process.

s1: Integration of Systems Engineering and Software Engineering activities.
s2: Integration of Systems Engineering and Software Engineering activities.

s1: describe the holistic and multi-disciplinary nature of complex engineering projects.
s2: describe the holistic and multi-disciplinary nature of complex engineering projects.

s1: identify and explain the activities involved in each phase of the Systems Engineering life-cycle.
s2: identify and explain the activities involved in each phase of the Systems Engineering life-cycle.

s1: explain the role of Software Engineering within the broader context of Systems Engineering.
s2: explain the role of Software Engineering within the broader context of Systems Engineering.

s1: Students will also improve their ability to understand and solve complex and ill-defined problems.
s2: Students will also improve their ability to understand and solve complex and ill-defined problems.

s1: Students will also improve their ability to communicate with the multi-disciplinary engineering team and the community at large.
s2: Students will also improve their ability to communicate with the multi-disciplinary engineering team and the community at large.

s1: Students will also improve their understanding of and commitment to ethical and professional responsibilities.
s2: Students will also improve their understanding of and commitment to ethical and professional responsibilities.

s1: Students will also improve their ability to function as an individual and as a team leader and member in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams.
s2: Students will also improve their ability to function as an individual and as a team leader and member in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams.
